pullRequest.body:
Add equivalences to move `Multiplicative` and `Additive` into the codomain of a pi type, both dependent and non-dependent.

```lean
    Multiplicative (∀ i : ι, K i) ≃* (∀ i : ι, Multiplicative (K i))

    Multiplicative (ι → G) ≃* (ι → Multiplicative G)

    Additive (∀ i : ι, K i) ≃+ (∀ i : ι, Additive (K i))

    Additive (ι → G) ≃+ (ι → Additive G)
```

Also add corresponding `Prod` equivalences.

From AperiodicMonotilesLean.


---

### PR summary [671711dfc9](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17040/commits/671711dfc9357b652ac1cc7527579834ebf35b85)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Equiv.TypeTags | 186 | 202 | +16 (+8.60%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Equiv.TypeTags`|16|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ AddEquiv.funAdditive`
`+ AddEquiv.piAdditive`
`+ AddEquiv.prodAdditive`
`+ MulEquiv.funMultiplicative`
`+ MulEquiv.piMultiplicative`
`+ MulEquiv.prodMultiplicative`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

A `Prod` version would require an extra import somewhere, or else a new file, neither this file nor `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Prod` imports the other.

```lean
/-- `Multiplicative (G × H)` is equivalent to `Multiplicative G × Multiplicative H`. -/
@[simps]
def MulEquiv.prodMultiplicative (G H) [Add G] [Add H] :
    Multiplicative (G × H) ≃* Multiplicative G × Multiplicative H where
  toFun := fun x ↦ (Multiplicative.ofAdd (Multiplicative.toAdd x).1,
    Multiplicative.ofAdd (Multiplicative.toAdd x).2)
  invFun := fun (x, y) ↦ Multiplicative.ofAdd (Multiplicative.toAdd x, Multiplicative.toAdd y)
  left_inv := fun _ ↦ rfl
  right_inv := fun _ ↦ rfl
  map_mul' := fun _ _ ↦ rfl

/-- `Additive (G × H)` is equivalent to `Additive G × Additive H`. -/
@[simps]
def AddEquiv.prodAdditive (G H) [Mul G] [Mul H] :
    Additive (G × H) ≃+ Additive G × Additive H where
  toFun := fun x ↦ (Additive.ofMul (Additive.toMul x).1,
    Additive.ofMul (Additive.toMul x).2)
  invFun := fun (x, y) ↦ Additive.ofMul (Additive.toMul x, Additive.toMul y)
  left_inv := fun _ ↦ rfl
  right_inv := fun _ ↦ rfl
  map_add' := fun _ _ ↦ rfl
```

> A `Prod` version would require an extra import somewhere,

I think this extra import would be fine in the current file. If the file can afford to import the elementwise operations on pi types, then I would expect it to do so for pairs too.
`Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Prod` actually imports a lot more than should be needed just to define the operations (`Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Opposite` and `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Units.Hom`).
If you make the change and push the commit, then CI will count exactly how bad it is in [this comment](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17040#issuecomment-2366964586).

Done, though I think putting these definitions instead in `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Prod`, with the new import going the other way, would mean many fewer new imports in total (but be less consistent as a location).

Looking at the numbers above, I think this is telling us that every file downstream that imports `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Equiv.TypeTags` already imports `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Prod` anyway, so the change only affects the dependencies of this one file.

:v: jsm28 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10985500688/job/30497442540)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10985500688/job/30497442666)

bors d+

Thanks! Feel free to merge when CI passes.

In the long run I guess we ccould have `import Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Prod.Basic` to match `import Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Pi.Basic`, but since this file is only used in 4 very downstream places I don't think we care.
Probably we should have these for `Prod` too.

bors d+

Thanks! Feel free to merge when CI passes.

In the long run I guess we ccould have `import Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Prod.Basic` to match `import Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Pi.Basic`, but since this file is only used in 4 very downstream places I don't think we care.

```suggestion
  toFun := fun x i ↦ Multiplicative.ofAdd <| Multiplicative.toAdd x i
```

```suggestion
  toFun := fun x i ↦ Additive.ofMul <| Additive.toMul x i
```

If you're sure you want this at all, 
```suggestion
abbrev MulEquiv.funMultiplicative (ι) (G) [AddZeroClass G] :
```
`AddZeroClass` seems stronger than needed, `Add` alone seems to work.
Changed to `Add`.

```suggestion
variable (ι) (G) in
/-- `Multiplicative (ι → G)` is equivalent to `ι → Multiplicative G`. -/
abbrev MulEquiv.funMultiplicative [Add G] :
```
to make the same variables be reused rather than leaving the universes up to chance

nit:
```suggestion
  toFun x := fun i ↦ Multiplicative.ofAdd <| Multiplicative.toAdd x i
  invFun x := Multiplicative.ofAdd fun i ↦ Multiplicative.toAdd (x i)
  left_inv _ := rfl
  right_inv _ := rfl
  map_mul' _ _ := rfl
```
(and below)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/Group/Equiv/TypeTags): moving `Multiplicative` inside pi types
